description: Set up API access for Vercel, a platform for deploying and hosting web applications with automatic CI/CD.

outputs.description: Personal access token for the Vercel API

steps.message: We'll create a Vercel personal access token for API access. This token can manage deployments, projects, and team settings.
Opening the Vercel tokens page. Sign in if prompted.
Click 'Create Token'. Give it a descriptive name (e.g. your project name). Choose an appropriate scope and expiration.
Copy the token and paste it here:
steps.validation_error: That doesn't look like a valid Vercel token. It should be a 24-character alphanumeric string.

steps.on_failure: Couldn't verify the token. Make sure you copied it correctly and it hasn't expired.

gotchas: Tokens are only shown once when created. If you lose it, you'll need to create a new one.
Tokens inherit your account permissions. Use scoped tokens for CI/CD pipelines.
Set an expiration date on tokens â€” avoid creating tokens that never expire.
For team projects, make sure the token has access to the correct team scope.
